verb.description: Cause the death of (a person, animal, or other living thing)
examples: her father was killed in a car crash
a robber armed with a shotgun who kills in cold blood

verb.description: Put an end to or cause the failure or defeat of (something)
examples: the committee voted to kill the project

verb.description: Pass (time, or a specified amount of it), typically while waiting for a particular event.
examples: when he reached the station he found he actually had an hour to kill

noun.description: An act of killing, especially of one animal by another.
examples: a lion has made a kill

phrases: He's courageous, fast, tireless and certainly not squeamish about being in at the kill.
In that event, it seems quite possible the French jackal will be in at the kill as well.
One side of politics finds a hint of weakness in the other side and goes in for the kill.
As Watson went in for the kill, a desperate Eubank caught him with a right hand and took the ascendancy.
Like the bloodhounds they are, they must have sniffed the overpowering scent of money mixed with a human rights issue, and went in for the kill.
origin: Mid 17th century: from Dutch kil, from Middle Dutch kille riverbed, channel.
